events.description: Self-Audit #0: First full 6-agent evaluation of BoardClaude
Self-Audit #1: Re-audit after resolving all 10 Iteration 0 action items. Score improved +12.3 points.
Self-Audit #2: Re-audit after resolving 7 Iteration 1 action items. Score improved +2.8 points.
Self-Audit #3: All iter-2 action items resolved. First STRONG_PASS verdict. Score improved +2.7 points.
Self-Audit #4: All iter-3 action items resolved. Score improved +1.17 points. 5 of 6 agents STRONG_PASS.
Self-Audit #5: All iter-4 action items resolved. First A grade. All 6 agents STRONG_PASS. Score improved +2.65 points.
Self-Audit #6: Iter-5 items resolved (RadarChart typing, AGENT_COLORS satisfies, LanguageProvider removed, SECURITY.md). Try-It-Now accessibility gaps identified. Score improved +0.78 points.

Self-Audit #7: Post iter-6 fixes. Regression -6.93 points driven by Thariq's stricter AI innovation evaluation (68.9). Static thinking budgets, no cross-iteration memory, and absent debate rounds penalized heavily.

Self-Audit #8: Score flat (-0.36). Iter-7 action items largely unresolved across all agents. Thariq (71.3) remains lowest -- 80KB context cap and no cross-iteration memory. 4/6 agents STRONG_PASS, Thariq/Jason at PASS.

Self-Audit #9: Score flat (0.0). Thariq (74.35) still lowest but improved +3.05. Lydia (87.95) highest. Route handler decomposition and debate model upgrade identified as top priorities. 4/6 agents STRONG_PASS.

Self-Audit #10: Score flat (-0.06). 9 iter-9 action items resolved (route decomposition, Boris tool_use, debate Opus, EvaluationList, OG image, README, landing page loop, BYOK UX, tests 106->111). Persistent gaps: serial file fetch (2 iters), SSE type assertions (2 iters), 1/6 agentic. 4/6 STRONG_PASS.

Self-Audit #11 (post /bc:fix): 3 iter-10 items resolved (synthesis validation, parallel fetch, SSE type guards). Score +0.46. Boris +3.2, Cat +2.15, Lydia +1.0. Thariq (75.05) still lowest -- 5/6 single-turn, decorative debate. 4/6 STRONG_PASS.
